tldr: The authors determined the crystal structure of p-nitrophenyl-N-acetylglucosaminide monohydrate, a semi-synthetic substrate of lysozyme. The molecule has a chair form glucopyranose ring and its structure is close to other sugars. The packing of the molecules is determined by a complete scheme of hydrogen bonding, forming an infinite nitrophenyl-N-acetylglucosaminide/water/nitrophenyl-acetylglucosaminide'sandwich' in the crystal structure.
